intro: Martellidendron hornei, commonly known as the Horne's martellidendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, making it an ornamental plant in some regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
